Qjihiy_zFqE5SKZe2IUQJQ.text: Was at Divine Barrel Brewery and this truck pulled up.  I saw the word lobster and was immediately like - YEP!  Once they were ready to go, the line was long immediately, but they moved rather quickly.  I ordered the Connecticut Roll; the Lobster Tots; and a Whoopie Pie.  The roll and tots were amazing! I was surprised that I enjoyed the lobster tots as much as I did. They were actually really flavorful. ...he whoopie pie I can live without... For a food truck my order was kinda pricey, but all things considered I will definitely add this truck to my 'Favs' list.  :-)

PC4gXVIX5TqE9Cdh0MSjIQ.text: Finally made it to Cousins food truck for their famous lobster roll.  Having lived and traveled extensively in New England, I've eaten my fair share of lobster rolls in Maine and Massachusetts. I think the price is just fine and had no issue with the price, as most lobster rolls are over $20. My main issue was the roll itself, too much mayonnaise (I got the Maine Roll) and roll was soggy and did not have great flavor.  A perfect Maine lobster roll should have just a touch of mayonnaise and served on a crispy buttered split top roll.  The lobster portion was very good but the flavor was just ok. It tasted like some fresh and some not so fresh lobster meat (some of the texture was off too).  For a few extra dollars, there are better lobster rolls in Charlotte.  Edit and response to owner- hi Michele- thanks for responding.  Besides the goop I'd mayo, I would also check the freshness of the lobster. Some of the bites were off in taste and texture. This was uptown on Tryon on July 31

ywYlmbZJGUTOndonwxFzdA.text: Pretty good quality lobster on my trip to the food truck however it was extremely over priced for the amount of lobster you get. My coworker paid for "2" additional sides of lobster that's an extra $10 and got an 8 oz container which would be fine but half way down she found shredded lettuce is what filled the remainder of the cup. Not cool for a $30 plus lunch ... Lots of other places for Lobster now in uptown I don't  expect lobster to be cheap but they jip you for sure ...  First time and most likely last time  ...   since i can't respond to a response. How many ounces of lobster can you expect as I don't see that any where ??

LRQSVu1CZPCMIeXI-4OLUQ.text: Way way to expensive, two rolls, 36$, paying for nuckle meat, over cooked and rubbery, way to much hype, trying to pay back Barbara from shark tank, i was really looking  for a great lobster roll

8iqhLzWp-ncupt1RWD_aIQ.text: As others have said I am also not sure why all the hype around this food truck. On the recommendation of the food truck the lobster quesadilla are the best for sharing. What a mistake. at best a 6" quesadilla sprinkled with lobster and some salsa on the side. Cheese was good on it. I took pictures but my wife deleted them because she formed a bond with the guy running the food truck for some reason. This was a waste of $14.50 plus tax and I know she tipped. I would never eat here again. Let me also say I think all the brewery's we have been to and we go to a lot them the food truck food is  all sub par at best at every one

ExIyn2edG17qxvR8v9pvtw.text: 5 bites of food has never cost so much. The size of the rolls were comical for being $17 each; after looking at the prices initially, we considered eating elsewhere because it is more than we'd usually pay for a sandwich, but decided to stick it out because of the food trucks good reputation.  I understand lobster is an expensive food, but I have had better quality lobster rolls at better quality establishments for a much better price... the experience was disappointing to say the least.   The food tasted fine, but customers should never leave with an empty wallet AND an empty stomach.

2Enqr-VYboEqWe898_HZkA.text: Tasted good but too expensive, We paid over 50 bucks for 2 rolls and a side but I ate it in  2 bites and then we were still hungry. No value for the amount of food you get. Total ripoff

Pau7aFKgTL6jKFl9IjNhlQ.text: Bad customer service. If a worker gets your order wrong, you shouldn't have to get back in a long line or be treated like you were in the wrong.

RRgmFohvWcMNNv-bUspvJw.text: Best lobster roll I have had in a very long time! It was worth the wait for about 30 minutes. The line at Sweet Union grew very quickly and was 25-30 deep for a solid 2 hours. The tater tots are amazing!

vNQBi9w-OrqKUKbj6bavag.text: Don't waste your money. The roll was stale, the lobster had no flavor ( you can tell that it's frozen, not fresh). They put just a small amount of mayo on the bun, not enough to even taste. The only reason they are getting 2 stars and not 1 is the amount of lobster you get. The concept is there, just not the flavor. If they were more passionate about how their product went out, this would be a hit.

-Ur0q0j9HHhDBNyVVCV9NQ.text: Finally got the chance to try the truck.  I got the lobster bisque and the Connecticut roll.  The lobster bisque had decent flavor but was very thick, like it had been sitting warming a little too long.  The roll was ok.  There was a good amount of lobster on it but the lobster was very chewy.  It also could have used a little more lemon flavor as I could only taste butter.

YY6x-Pjbmi63xoRr69C57g.text: Tasty Connecticut Lobster roll with a side of tator tots! Lobster wasn't rubbery at all and the tots were nice and crispy. It is a bit expensive but it's lobster after all and it tastes really good! Nice soft roll and I've got no complaints.

6x6fwfw7b0r3txj221yEFw.text: Connecticut lobster roll was alright; the bread was the star, and the lobster itself was sub-par.  For the price it's a strong pass.  The tots were good, but not worth $4 along with the sandwich. Portion sizes and price points are something they'll need to work on.

pIiknNCm3yiFKsJ16eM6Zw.text: The food was amazing. We had the lobster tacos- okay, the Connecticut roll- pretty good but the size of the roll was small, and the lobster tots- which was amazing . I think overall it was good but the food was over priced. Would compare to a high end restaurant. You can always go but would you go knowing it was expensive.

G55hhWkl3gBCItb9EI3gZw.text: We had the Connecticut's lobster roll. Very buttery and delicious chunky pieces of lobster meat! I can't wait to try them again.

QcdYQJFnBTu7ChTLilZ-DQ.text: Decent food, overpriced. Will not try again.   I am a food truck and lobster lover so I thought this would be great. I ordered the lobster grilled cheese and lobster bisque. $14.95 for the sandwich and $5 for the soup. The bread is plain and thin, reminded me of the 99 cent loaf bread, two slices of cheese and some lobster. The soup had ONE tiny piece of lobster in the cup, but it had good flavor. I am a firm believer in paying more for better food but this was not worth the money.

gc34dRL8VT6b2Blm2PNleA.text: This food truck definitely lived up to the hype. I got the Connecticut roll and the lobster was so fresh and flavorful. The line was long even though we arrived before they opened and it didn't move too fast because they cook everything fresh but it was worth the wait. I will definitely keep an eye on their schedule to see where they'll be next.

oDpCWMchKhd9EJK4P0Tcqw.text: Blue blaze brewery last Saturday. I arrived at 11:30am and sat in my car until around 11:40 when I saw others driving into parking lot across the street.  I was #2 in line when truck opened at 12. The wait for order was abt 15mins.  I ordered both lobster rolls and lobster tacos and also side order of tots. Tots delicious and plentiful for $4!! Both rolls were loaded and worth every penny!! Tacos lacked in size and lobster quantity for the price. I'll stick with the rolls and tots and maybe try the grilled cheese next time.

zLUgBV1YQ_nIRt7nd3O4Og.text: We tried the lobster quesadillas and the lobster grilled cheese. It was by far the best decision I made all week!! Seasoned to perfection!! 4 stars because they are extremely pricey for what you get.  I would say the quesadillas were definitely worth over paying, the grilled cheese was not worth anywhere near what they are charging.

un7KYNtjbqPJTPNsAQ5Z1Q.text: Totally over-hyped!  Have no idea where these 5 stars come from.    I was craving lobster roll so I had the Maine lobster roll at FTF-South End.  On a positive note, the wait wasn't too crazy.  However, the lobster was a very mushy texture and flavor-less.  None of that sweet buttery flavor you expect.  Seems like it was defrosted and sitting around too long.  A lobster roll lives and dies on the strength of the lobster and this was really lacking.    My roll was room temp and no mayo.  Huh?  This definitely was not a Maine lobster roll and not worth $18.   Bottom line: bland, frozen, over-priced, over-hyped.

DSspjYTMOm_IK7RWuUJOig.text: I am really, really sorry to break the 5-star review streak. This place was awesome, but tonight they were a part of the Cotswold Trucks Food Truck Rally and I think they were suffering from a mild case of "In the Weeds." Still, they delivered in several regards and I see this place doing outstanding here in the QC.  Yes, they were on shark tank. Uh huh, celebrities have endorsed them. Ok ok, they have a ton of different media logos all over their truck. Hype, hype, hype. I don't care what Mariah Carey thinks, I just want the food!   The rally started at 5:30 and I was there as soon as it started. Sure enough, the new kids on the block already had a line 30-deep and they were churning out food as fast as they could. To my surprise, they were really hustling as the line was moving at a steady pace. When I got to the window I ordered the Lobster Tacos with a cup of New England Clam Chowder.  Wait was about 10 minutes for my order and since this visit was more on a whim, I took my food to my car. First off, Chowder: Wonderful, Velvety, Hot, Fresh. It seemed that every bite had some clam in it, they definitely didn't skimp out on it, and it was seasoned masterfully. Wonderful job on the chowder.  My tacos looked and tasted unbelievably fresh. I think that if 10 years ago you told someone you were going to a church parking lot at night to eat seafood from a big van, they'd think you'd lost it! Nevertheless, this was very, very fresh food! You could pick out every individual note of the pico, and the cilantro-lime sauce was perfect. This is where my review could have been a slam dunk, but fell just a bit short. At first I thought the sauce just wasn't strong and the dish lack seasoning, however as I looked at my tacos, I noticed that two tacos were only partially topped in the sauce. The third taco had only one little drop of the sauce, and it really showed in the overall package. This sauce is the linchpin in the whole dish: Salty, savory, a bit of acidity, the entire dish relies on it for seasoning and every bite needs a bit of it. That final taco missing all but one little drop of sauce was somewhat of a disappointment.   I attest this oversight to the insane line they had tonight. Under more ideal conditions I'm sure this wouldn't be the case. I can tell that they're very passionate about what they're doing and you can't say they aren't putting their all in the effort. Tonight's sample of the menu has me wanting more. I'm a believer, and a follower... Just, keep me interested!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. My last taco, one little drop of the delicious sauce.
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. They&#39;re.... Kinda a big deal.
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Back of the truck.

lz6fq-bxib4LYoJHHDRj9g.text: They did not skimp on the meat... yay! But it wasn't ask flavorful as I was expecting...boo! I didn't taste the butter or lemon on my roll. Very friendly folks, line moved quickly and my roll was ready in less than 10 mins I'd say.  Next time I'll likely try one of their offerings that comes with pico and a sauce to add some flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut Roll and Tots

tv-vH7RkOxt_dA_kqvOEqA.text: This former New Englander stood in line for 2 hrs and it was worth every minute!! I tried their Clam Chowder, a Connecticut roll, and a Maine roll (didn't eat the bun on the rolls, but they were toasted and looked delish!). Everything was fantastic! Actually, the Clam Chowder was one of the best I've had...and I've had a LOT of clam chowder in my day!   I brought a whoopie pie home for my son and he said it was very good.   Will def be on the lookout for Cousins repeat visits to my area.

H3sNbSrLK6_vhZ9hU-DN2g.text: This is more a 3.5 star rating. We got to try Cousins food truck at the Water Lantern Festival, and the line was long, so surely there's merit to how good the food must be, right? We got the Connecticut roll, lobster grilled cheese, a cup of clam chowder, a whoopie pie, and drink. The roll was packed full of lobster on a buttery bun, but there was only a faint lemon butter taste. I also fished out three bits of shell from my roll in three separate bites, which is a serious choking hazard if the roll had been given to the family in front of us in line, who had two small kids. The grilled cheese was my favorite, but it wasn't as packed with lobster as the rolls. The chowder was tasty and full of clam, so worth every penny. The whoopie pie was a prepackaged chocolate cake/frosting sandwich. Value-wise, I say the rolls are the best bang for your buck, but you just have to be careful with chewing and watch out for shells.

dTgTAaxKM74WH-2B75_dBg.text: Cousins finally makes their debut in Charlotte and after a couple weeks of what I thought would be waiting for crowds to die down, was actually just time for the following to multiply. It was DELICIOUS. take this from a girl who LOVES her Florida lobster. Now, you may think it ridiculous to wait 90 mins in line for a palm-sized sandwich. Normally I would never wait that long for food in general. But, we were at a brewery, as is common for a Saturday afternoon in Charlotte, and had the entertainment of live music and great co versatiles with friends to get us through. They operated on a limited menu, expecting floods of people. service was extremely quick. Our lobster rolls (I had a Maine and a Connecticut) were out before I even finished paying. The nest was tender, juicy and wrapped in a toasted piece of bread that was buttered to perfection.    I can't wait to try them again (hopefully one Friday for lunch) and experience the other menu items. Lobster tots looked incredible and the lobster quesadilla looked divine.   Welcome to Charlotte, Cousins! We hope you have enjoyed your welcome, and stick around for years to come!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

GjrSzwggl5nbbeH7-FpQAQ.text: Went out of our way to Food Truck Friday in Dilworth with my wife because CML truck was going to be there and she wanted to try it.   She wanted a lobster roll just like from Connecticut where she grew up.  The line around 730 was pretty long, but folks around seemed happy with the food.  We had a Connecticut Roll. She was happy, said it was the closest thing to authentic since moving to NC, though portion seemed smaller. Lobster was cooked perfectly and not overdone like many places. The clam chowder was also better than we have had around.   Overall we would get it again, but it's a bit expensive to make a regular thing.

edl6GeG-ZcDmJriTmivtsw.text: Grabbed some lunch today from them and the food was fantastic! I order the lobster grilled cheese and the portions and flavors was great. The lobster wasn't chewy and it tasted fresh. The cheeses they used was perfect for a grilled cheese sandwich. My boyfriend got their shrimp tacos and he gobbled that down before I was able to finish my sandwich, so I'm assuming it was delicious. He said it was very flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Grilled Cheese
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Tacos

KrU5Jci-WDqeNRDjTxVX_Q.text: Very good!!!  Went to the food truck today at Cabella's.  Had seen the menu before. Very friendly people, had a lobster roll, it was VERY good and also very filling.

95CPb9RJ2jEh8t0XAdJVhA.text: Came across this food truck on our way to Beer Temple. They were parked outside of PIedmont Social House. I ordered the lobster roll with tots and my son ordered the cheese quesadilla. The lobster roll was on a buttery toasty bun and it was delicious. Had a good amount of lobster on it and you can taste the acidic from the lemon that was lightly squeezed on it. Delicious! The tots were hot and tasty especially when you add the seasoning that they had for it - maybe some kind of Cajun seasoning nor seafood seasoning. My son liked his cheese quesadilla because it had a lot of cheese on it which he loves. Can't go wrong with that. It was prepared fast too.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ve9i8X79AMXlu7mVRfD2FQ.text: Great food truck! Connecticut style lobster was great, however it could use a little more seasoning and butter sauce on side. Lobster bisque was also delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

Y8NI267CijRH7YKm5gmmfw.text: Very small amount of food for the high price. Taste was decent but not worth the money in my opinion.  Trying it at least erased the question mark in regards to this food truck, but not worth a second visit.  The roll pictured was $17...geesh.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

wWTCa7wKcUEwmUQN9WGalQ.text: Lobster rolls are expensive, I've paid $30 for lobster rolls in sit down restaurants, $16 for a good lobster roll is definitely on market for a food truck. That said, if price is an issue, just get a lobster roll and go to Harris Teeter to get yourself a bag of chips.  We did a team lunch order with 10+ orders and all the food came out really well. Counsins took the care to wrap up everything for us and label it, so a plus there.  All that said, a few items of improvements... please be there on time. The food truck came late and had credit card machine issues after opening late, resulting in customers waiting in the heat for 30 minutes past the scheduled open before even being able to order.  We had a large order and would have been willing to submit it online or call ahead, early. Understanding the logistics difficulty potentially, but why not allow for some online orders and develop a queuing system?  All that said, good classic lobster rolls for a reasonable price. Check them out.

igThU1I3inNGf8mQNDzSwQ.text: I had the Connecticut. It was perfect.  Straight high quality Lobster slightly warmed in butter in a slightly toasted folded bread.  It' is not cheap for what you get, but I would much rather have quality of quantity.  I tried the clam chowder too and it was amazing.   Anytime this truck is in the Lake Norman area I will seek it out.

it0SLRpcbMZg5POcf7TbeQ.text: Well we're from Boston and were thrilled to see the truck in our area.  We had Connecticut lobster roll. Quite a long wait. Taste factor was medium.   Not nearly as big as you get up north and 16.95 for one lobster roll is very expensive.  Not sure we'll be back.

ODlcGJ1sY3tdkgk9WDwX5A.text: Their brand was on Shark Tank... but it is franchised. Anyone can buy into it.  To say the lobster is fresh.... there is no way that lobster was fresh. Whoever believes it is,has never been to Maine or Massachusetts. I go to Maine annually just for lobster. It was definitely frozen but that's not even the issue. I agree with Shana's earlier review. Very disappointed with the flavor; I expected much better. I won't rush out for Cousins again but would give them a second chance. Hoping for a better experience.

osmmjOIoEi8UI8tjgS8kpg.text: Yo! The lobster grilled cheese was the business .... my friend insisted we try this truck and I'm glad we did. I couldn't decided since all of the options looked so tasty. So we all got a few options. The grilled cheese was the popular choice but the tots were a perfect match. Yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

qL4fe1uFrRM-kfHqhCeABQ.text: I wanted to love Cousins Maine Lobster. As a lover of the Northeast, specifically Maine and all things lobster, I was disappointed by the portion size. Paying $16.95 for a lobster rolls makes me assume I'm going to get a decent amount of lobster and it just wasn't the case. We got a Maine roll, a CT roll, a CT roll sans bun, and a lobster quesadilla. The CT roll sans but was just lettuce dumped in a soup container. Have some pride in your presentation and put it over some lettuce or something! Part of me thinks I'd like to give them another try, but I'm not convinced it's worth it.

XV8-Cvm60nNGAW9htPkgrA.text: I was sooo looking forward to eating here but overall, this was a disappointing experience. We got the main lobster roll and Connecticut roll with a side of lobster bisque. The rolls were on hot dog buns, not a hoagie like I was expecting. The lobster was "meaty" but honestly both rolls were so tasteless. I would understand the hype and price if it was flavorful, but there was absolutely no taste to the rolls. I get that lobster will cost you more than your average meal but the food is overpriced for what you get. The lobster bisque was pretty good but don't expect a huge portion for what you pay.

K6JEKP7DYyEwEEfawMNISw.text: I had heard about this truck and got to try it at the Rock Hill Food Truck Friday. I was one of the first 10 orders in line as I had heard they get crowded. I ordered the Maine roll for authenticity, as a combo with the tots and a soda. The order came out quickly and the staff was very friendly, informative, and generous with ketchup. The roll was very good, the lobster was fresh and chilled. I wish it was larger but I get it. It's lobster not sliced steak. The tots were piping hot and delicious. Probably the best I've ever had. Probably should give 5 stars but it is a food truck so.... Cousin's met and exceeded my expectations.

Rr8ZbdvOHwoCuIZjrq7OZg.text: I've been trying to track this truck down for a while and I was able to catch them on a Friday night and was first in line.  I wasn't interested in the grilled cheese or tater tots, etc., just the lobster roll please........correction the Connecticut Lobster Roll, as it is served warmed and without mayo.......yes, that one........$17 bucks! Ouch! But I get it, it's lobster and I had no problems with the price tag after devouring that roll, it was really good, really fresh, really sweet on a buttery toasted roll!    Several weeks later they were near my building during lunch and I tried them again, getting the same Connecticut roll, but this time my bread was soggy and several pieces of lobster shell was present, so I was very disappointed after dropping $17 this time around.  So, I still think the other lobster truck has my heart for now, as they are more consistent.  I am willing to try Cousin's a 3rd time but I will need some time before I forget about that soggy bread and several pieces lobster shell pieces I had to take out of my mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

9VQRm3dfphSim3Rbm1MQLg.text: Had the New England Clam Chowder and it was excellent. Popular franchised food truck, might remember from Shark Tank several years ago, worth checking out where the truck is located in Charlotte if your into New England Lobster and cams! The bowl of New England Chowder I purchased for $8 was great, full of clams! I also heard from someone in line behind me that the Lobster Rolls were some of the best, similar to what you would get in New England! Another person in line sounded like they are regulars and follow the whereabouts of this particular food truck!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

QDkTSH7sesR2sBW70Q9lDQ.text: I like many first saw the food truck on Shark tank so I was completely surprised when I heard it was coming to good ole Dallas NC. Showed up at the Old Dallas brewery. Did a good job by both of getting it out on social media.   I have never had a lobster roll nor been up north so I don't have anything to compare it too either.    I knew being on a food truck it was not going to be cheap and it's lobster right.   I ordered the Connecticut roll and lobster tacos. The Connecticut roll was very tasty and full of flavor. The tacos were alright, think may have been missing a little of the sauce as another review mentioned because they seemed a little dry.    Overall was a great experience, the food was great and the service was great.  From order to pick up was around 10 minutes.   I will agree with other reviews that it is expensive, the tacos are reasonably priced at $14.50. The rolls at 16.95 could be a couple inches longer for that price. Again, I have no complaints everything was great but it would be hard to frequent too often at that price.

R8qZHwEzbW7yHWfHBceivA.text: I didn't realize that there was so much buzz revolving around this food truck. This is also due to the fact that I don't watch Shark Tank.  This food truck has become a regular at my job's business park so on a recent visit, I was excited to give them a try.   Full disclosure: I've never had a lobster roll before this truck so I have absolutely nothing else to compare it to.  When I arrived, there wasn't much of a line so I placed my order for the Connecticut lobster roll and waited 10 minutes, tops. They have a large screen TV in the middle of the truck that lists their menu items for the day. The total just for the roll was $19 plus change. By no means a cheap lunch. Once my name was called, I grabbed my roll and sprinkled the seasoning they had on their counter as well dropped a few drops of their hot sauce.  I dug in and was pleased at how much lobster they stuffed in the roll (I mean, for $19 this should be expected). Although I was surprised that the roll was on the shorter side. I expected a much bigger size, especially for the price. The bread was slightly toasted and generously buttered. It definitely held up against all of the lobster. I probably could have eaten the roll by itself.  The seasoning that I sprinkled on top definitely made it for me. I cannot imagine how bland the roll tastes without it. I would recommend a very healthy sprinkle of that stuff if you find yourself at the truck.  For my first time trying a lobster roll, I was definitely satisfied.  When the truck makes another visit, I'll probably try the lobster tots.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side view of the truck
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Close up of the Connecticut
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut roll

bZ-px0OT5XCmXH479ZB4fw.text: I had been looking forward to this food truck for three years. Three. Years. So as soon as I heard they were coming to a local bottle shop I immediately started making plans. This food truck is well executed. Like, I got in line, maybe 15 people back, and expected an hour wait. No. 15 mins in and out. And they know how to move people along.   I had the lobster tots. I was in love but I wish I would  have asked for the toppings on the side because too much pico, not enough sauce. I also got the lobster bisque since I didn't know if I would ever have the opportunity again. My friend got the roll and clam chowder and I hate to admit it but his soup won. It was so good!   I highly recommend checking them out but grab a beer and come good company while you wait in line and just remember it's worth the wait.

FgVsPJ336IngYOUTQCd0-w.text: This has to be my favorite food truck.  Ever. I've never had a lobster roll before and eating one has been on my list for a long time and this experience did not disappoint. They were at a local Tap House on Super Bowl Sunday and I knew I had to stop. I'm so, so glad I did. People in line were like a cult following them around from location to location and eager to talk about their favorite fare. I heard about the chowder, tacos and quesadillas over and over again.   I went with the Maine lobster roll and it was so good! The roll was toasted and buttered and filled with fresh, cold hunks of lobster. The Mayo was barely detectable but definitely added flavor.   I can't post this review without talking about how much they have their act together. I have been to a lot food trucks and the main theme is waiting. Not here. There was a line to order and it moved quickly. I was super impressed at how fast our order was ready.    I'm really looking forward to eating here again and I understand why fans go to them now.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maine Lobster Roll

UVU8eCgyAFoMkdPtWYQ2PA.text: I found the food to be fresh, the service was timely and polite. The prices are fair IMO, it's lobster not 80% ground beef. Will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maine lobster roll and tots

u3KYGv4186YgPnmmoq7MAQ.text: I'd been waiting for Wednesday all week because i'd been craving a Lobster Roll. Expecting to see my go to truck on the schedule at the Whitehall lunch rally, I was disappointed to see that they wouldn't be there. But excited to see there was another option. Walking up to the truck there was a crowd surrounding it. Checking out the menu, I loved the variation in options!! I was excited to try everything, but I narrowed it to 2 options, and just ordered both :-). I ordered the Lobster Grilled Cheese Sandwich Combo #2 (Tots & Drink), and the Connecticut Lobster Roll.   The wait wasn't long at all. I walked to the car to clear my hands so I could carry my food, by the time I returned my food was ready. Before walking away I season my food with what looked like Old Bay but could have also been a different cajun type seasoning, I couldn't tell. I also grabbed a few pieces of foil and more Ketchup. It was pretty annoying how stingy they were with the Ketchup. 2 packs for a full basket of tots? Then when asking for more, I unfortunately only got 2 more.  Now it's time to eat and I was excited. Everything was still really warm, I only work a couple minutes away. Starting with the tots, they were a little disappointing, but I already knew that from the one I tasted before wrapping them up. Lacked salt & weren't crispy at all. Thank goodness for the seasoning they had there which made them edible. The Lobster Roll was ok. It was pretty dry and lacked that punch of lobster flavor that I wanted. Needed a bit more butter and salt. The Grilled Cheese was the star for me. Plenty of lobster between 2 buttery slices of bread and melted cheese. It was yummy.   All in all it wasn't bad, but not enough for me to neglect the Lobster Dogs  Food Truck... except for the Grilled Cheese. They are also more expensive than Lobster Dogs at $16.95 vs Lobster Dogs $15. But I would give them another try being that they are still pretty new and finding their flow, especially since soon they will be a regular at my job every other Wednesday!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut Lobster Roll
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Grilled Cheese
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

uPU_BJY2B83w8k1FQXH0DQ.text: Main lobster roll- my friend loved it! She said she'd order it again! Better than the lobster at Capital Grill.  Tots- Really yummy!!  Kids grilled cheese & tots- not great grilled cheese! The tots were the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kids grilled cheese and tots - the tots were the best part. The grilled cheese was edible but not great
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fabulous tots!! $4      worth it!!!

Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Main lobster roll- my friend thought it was really good. Better than what you can get at Capital grill. She&#39;d order it again.

UTqHGGUvnv78FxiUrVBZBQ.text: Randomly stumbled upon this food truck while at Sycamore brewing. I realize this is a unicorn event as this truck has their own following and people flock to wherever this bad boy parks.   Got the infamous lobster tots and they were delicious! I was a little disappointed in the amount of lobster in the tots- I think the truck in Raleigh serves more in this dish. Maybe my lobster luck ran out that day.   Just a heads up: This is a more pricey food truck but remember their main ingredient is lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

3hIP2iPcp2otzUJTEm1MEw.text: Prior to taking our trip to Maine, we figured we might as well try out one of those fancy lobster rolls, right here in Charlotte, so when we noticed they would be out and about and we would be nearby, we stopped at the truck.  First, the setup: Food trucks can be notoriously difficult to track down. On this front, Cousins is firing on all cylinders. They were where they said they would be, and it was easy to find that information.  Next, the truck itself: As is probably to be expected from a more high-profile business, they are not skimping. Rather than a lunch wagon variety, there is no shortage of touting that you've seen them on TV, and their menu is broadcast not on chalkboards, but on monitors on the outside. All in all, it's an impressive display. That alone does not make for a good meal, but it's a definite difference from what many other food trucks may show you with their first impression, to be sure.  Then you get to the ordering. This one can be a challenge, simply because everyone wants to see that "Shark Tank Food Truck". Frankly, I can take it or leave it. Sure, I was also in that line, but I was more interested because we were headed on our trip to Maine than the fact that they were on Shark Tank - that's just a bonus. Or a headache, such as it is. In this case, it can make for a long line. The good news is that the line generally movies quickly - at least to order.  After placing the order, however, it can move a bit more slowly. That isn't really news to anyone who has ordered off a food truck - then can always be slow, and on this case it wasn't any worse than any other food truck, and in fact it was probably better than most.  When it came to the food - it was a smallish sandwich, which can be disconcerting if you're paying up for something like lobster (or lobster grilled cheese - they are both rather pricey). But the taste was solid, at least the same as what we had on our Maine road trip. So if you don't want to go to Maine and get one, it's probably worth it. I mean it's not coming out of the water that morning, but you also probably didn't spend a few hundred (thousand?) dollars to get there and get your roll, did you?

1HfIJieEew5zCp55J77oaA.text: I have been wanting to try Cousins Maine Lobster ever since I saw it on Shark Tank. One day, I did a little research and saw that the truck would be visiting near my office. A bunch of us decided to check it out.   The food- takes forever. It was about 25 minutes from order to getting the food. By the time I got it, I was even more disappointed. I have had many a lobster roll in my life, so I know what I should reasonably expect. Unfortunately,  this one was drenched in a TON of watery mayo. The lobster was flavorless and didn't taste fresh. I can't really explain the lobster except not good seafood.  The roll was very soggy too. It was not crisp or buttered. I hate to say this, but Hickory Tavern makes a way better lobster roll than these guys and you don't have to wait outside on the curb for your food. Its comparable in price, but includes a side.   I wasn't full after eating my lobster roll, so I ended up adding some tots to my order. I didn't have to wait as long for those (took about 5 mins).  Those were good! They were fresh and good portion.

2YkzaRGoNuMVtY_E7XdzRQ.text: This truck does a classic Lobster Roll RIGHT. Lightest touch of mayo, always get a claw, and a lightly toasted and buttered roll. That's all you need!  The only downfall is the wait you'll have to stand in whenever this truck rolls around. I went to Sycamore Brewings Summer Fest just to get one of these rolls and waited in a like for over 2 hours. Yes. 2. Hours. Worth it? Yes (plus hey hey, sipping a couple brews made it not so bad). But holy cow. For a relatively simple recipe it was a little insane. I've been fortunate to grow up in the North East and miss authentic lobster rolls so much. Cousins falls right in line with the best, just mind the line ;)

XVK1t5dlr9pt0dvslVkSsA.text: A treat this Memorial Day weekend, when this truck came to our community. The menu features a variety of lobster rolls, Connecticut (mayo) and Maine (buttered)  both with tater tots if desired (extra cost), lobster grilled cheese, lobster bisque and New England clam chowder  just to name a few items. I ordered a deconstructed lobster salad (  plain lobster with a side of mayo) plus the lobster bisque. My dining mate ordered the lobster roll ( on a toasted roll) Our lobster meat tasted fresh , sweet and tender. The soup was delicious. In my opinion both overpriced for the quantity. About $17.00 for the roll, $6.00 for the  small cup of soup I have no idea whether the lobster was previously frozen but the taste was  very fresh. Indeed a treat for me and my dining mate who used to vacation yearly on Cap Cod and enjoyed lobster as well as other New England seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. menu
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster bisque
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. deconstructed lobster salad with tiny side of mayo

S70Pnw24ouPrERTIia1lHg.text: I never had Maine/Connecticut lobster rolls until this food truck came to town. I ordered one Maine Lobster Roll, a Connecticut roll, and finally a lobster bisque. There were visible strips of claw and knuckle meat, and each roll was overflowing with lobster meat. The Maine Lobster roll was served cold and a light touch of mayo. The Connecticut Lobster roll was served hot. The lemon and butter added a rich dimension to the lobster. I literally inhaled both rolls, but each were extremely delicious. The Lobster bisque was rich and creamy.  Even on a hot day, the bisque was quite filling. The service was fast and polite.  There was not much of a wait time between the order and receiving the order. I would highly recommend going back. I did note that there was some discussion on which Lobster Roll was the best.   I recommend getting both and determining which one is right for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut Lobster Roll
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Bisque.
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maine Lobster Roll.

vMDmO2QJiHa5fv82SVgVag.text: Honestly, the food is pricy. But it's sooo good, it's worth it! Plus, the service we got from the owner was great, he was super friendly. The food tasted fresh and delicious! I hope I don't come across their truck too often, or else I'll spend too much money on them

KHh7NtpFMIaeQPsxkIYqXg.text: TLDR: The food is what one would expect from a food truck serving lobster-it's just okay. The service is fast. The vibe is casual. All things considered, I believe the price is too high. I wouldn't get their food again but if you find yourself at Blue Blaze with an empty stomach and no desire to go home then consider Cousins Maine Lobster.

H_PacNdUBcu3rP0_rqPPzg.text: Cousins food truck definitely lives up to the hype!!!  Typically the line for Cousins is very long. However, we ended up catching it outside of Good Works cidery, where the line was very short. They have anything with lobster you can think of....lobster tacos, lobster tots, lobster tail, lobster bisque, lobster rolls, lobster quesadilla.   My husband and I settled on the Connecticut lobster roll as I do not love mayo much and the Connecticut roll is just butter! Yum! After about 10 minutes, our roll was ready. This roll was FULL of lobster. They definitely didn't skimp. The flavor was delicious and the lobster chunks were large. My only complaint is that I wish the roll could have been bigger. Like, keep the same lobster amount but spread it out over a larger roll.   Overall, the prices are on the higher end. Our roll with tip and tax was $19. However, they definitely give you your moneys worth in lobster!  Can't wait to return to try the lobster tacos!

j3hZYWgceITtSdLrF4hZKw.text: Yum! I wasn't very hungry but knew I had to get something. They have a nice selection and decent prices for what they serve. I got a bowl of the clam chowder because it's my favorite soup. I got it served piping hot. It was creamy and had a lot of clams in it. I was very pleased. I'm going to try a lobster roll next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Clam chowder-pretty good!

0jQWUsus3MRMO7Gt6VZXJA.text: We caught the food truck while it was up In Winston-Salem! The food was phenomenal. There was a group of us and by the time we all ordered, we pretty much tasted everything on the menu. I did give it 3 stars because the food is well overpriced. I know there are diehard fans of the Cousins establishment that would totally disagree with me and believe it's well worth it. Hear me when I tell you that I LOVE lobster! I got ya, but the inflated costs are just not warranted.  So, good food but at a cost!

wufstejXSV6h_lGoXh_kbQ.text: My husband has been raving about this for weeks, so we agreed to meet up at Slow Play in Rock Hill, where it featured this popular food truck.  Well, I have to agree with my husband... the Lobster Roll and the Tater Tots were Dee-Lish!! The Lobster was hot, fresh and savory...and per my custom request, they sprinkled some cheese on to my Roll, making it just about perfect. The Tater Tots were piping hot and perfectly fried...making it just as delicious!   I will say, however, that it was extremely overpriced (nearly 20 bucks for a roll)...especially for a fairly small-sized roll. If the roll was a tad bigger, I'd definitely rate it 5 stars. I also wish there was a Cousins restaurant, not just a chain of food trucks.  Overall, I LOVED the Lobster Roll, and will most definitely chase down this food truck again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Main Lobster Roll (with cheese sprinkles) &amp; Tater Tots

H8URPuNcjSz4zW0fVWOLDw.text: When your friends from Maine tell you that the lobster is legit, believe them & patronize this place as often as possible.  Like others have said, it's a bit pricey but the portion size, taste, quality, & service make it all worthwhile.  It is DELICIOUS & will not disappoint!  I first tried them at a lobster event @ Sycamore Brewing (another Charlotte must-have) & was fortunate enough to have them yesterday when they popped up in Uptown.  As a non-mayo fan, the Maine roll with extra seasoning, a squeeze of lemon, & a side of tots are my fave.  Already looking forward to the next one!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maine lobster roll!
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. #ForTheLoveOfTots

iEhdcwXpsZ7WWXyHRhURmA.text: I've been wanting to try a lobster roll and I noticed a FB events that stated that Cousins Maine Lobster Food Truck would be at an apartment complex near home.   I made the stop after work and was surprised that there weren't a lot of ppl in line. However there was consist business throughout my visit. People keep coming by and ordering.   The couple in front of me order almost $90 worth of food. Meanwhile I was trying to decided if I was going to be nice and order a roll for my mom.  I decided to be nice and got the Connecticut and Maine Lobster Roll.   The order was ready in about 5 minutes. I didn't add anything to the rolls and I kinda regret it. There was a lot of Lobster meat on each roll. I would say that it was well worth the price for the amount of meat you. However there wasn't much flavor to the rolls. The Connecticut Roll tasted like butter because of the buttered toast but the Maine just tasted like cooked lobster. I don't like mayo so I avoided it as best as I could when trying the Maine Lobster Roll. I did like how it wasn't heavily mayonnaisey tho. It was just a thin layer spread on the toast. I think both of the rolls needed a good amount of seasoning and even a few dishes of hot sauce to give it some flavor.   Based on the bland taste I'm not jumping to try another lobster roll but I may give Cousins Maine Lobster Truck another try and get another one of their menu items.   Cousins Maine Lobster Truck Tuesday May 21, 2019 6:45pm

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maine roll
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut roll
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut and Maine Lobster rolls

YLdW2hfjOImo4GxEQfPQjQ.text: We visited Sycamore Brewery in CLT, the Cousins truck was located in the clearing behind the brewery.   We had the lobster tacos, they were a bit small but so so worth it. The lobster was perfect, the sauce was light (not soggy) and the finely chopped toppings were fresh. I only mention the size because if you are sharing- get a side.  We had the loaded tater tops and they were terrific. Lastly we had a chocolate whoppie pie- they are pre packaged from Maine so I was skeptical, but they tasted great and the white icing tasted fresh and fluffy. Big enough too share.  I heard they are starting a Cousins truck in Philly- woo-hoo!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

1UsutN9g8rW7JKDhOE3j3A.text: Normally get a nice pile of lobster on the Connecticut roll. Today, didn't get enough lobster to make it high enough to pass the bun. Out of the bisque. Heard it was their second stop, but not an excuse for a $17 sandwich. This was at Tap-It in Fort Mill on Wednesday 8/28. GOT ROBBED

BlG4rXr4QiOLtxVvltwjZg.text: I almost wrote a review about a year ago about how I had to wait 45 mins + to get the food I ordered from this truck.  I think it's safe to say that experience was limited ( or so I hope) and that it was a small kink in the newness of this particular truck.  I had the CT roll with tots two weeks ago, and my husband had the Lobster Tots.  Neither of us can stop talking about how yummy our food was! Considering the lobster roll is $10.00 cheaper than any local spot, and is top notch compared to most, I am sold!  If you see the truck somewhere local, I say its worth it!!

E7R24g2NeYLULBJSXWTalg.text: Tried them for the first time at their one year anniversary event. They had a really long line but had a great speed of service and it was well organized. The staff was very helpful & friendly.  I had been wanting to try them for a while since I heard a lot of good things and their pictures always like really good. But I will say I was a bit disappointed. I was looking forward to the lobster grilled cheese the most and it was very underwhelming to say the least especially for the price. I also got the Connecticut roll which was also a slight disappointing, it did have a good amount of meat but was bland no taste of butter or lemon at all. I've had my fare share of lobster rolls and definitely had better.  My friend ordered the lobster tots & i got to try them and that was really good probably the best thing on the menu and the only reason I would want to go back. He also got the lobster tail and he enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster tail with side of tots
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Grilled Cheese
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut lobster roll

--MhwiQZLc987aOyyVj8nQ.text: We are the Cousins Maine lobster food truck while attending the water Lantern Festival in town.  The line was long, although I was pretty impressed with how fast they got the food out.   We ordered a Connecticut roll, lobster grilled cheese, New England clam chowder, whoopie pie, and drink. The Connecticut roll was packed pretty full. However it was pretty bland, and could barely taste any of the butter. There were also several bits of shell and cartilage in the meat. The lobster grilled cheese was delicious, but pretty sparse with the lobster meat, offering only a few small chunks in the middle of the sandwich. The chowder was tasty, and packed with clam meat in almost every bite. The whoopie pie was a prepackaged cake sandwich. Girlfriend seemed to enjoy it though.  Overall I think the prices are too high, especially for the grilled cheese which seemed to have less than half the meat that was in the roll (yet still priced only a couple dollars less than the roll). Also have to fault them for having lobster shells in our meat, when they are supposed to specialize in lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. New England clam chowder
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster grilled cheese
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut roll

MEpS6wza_bJ2Fp30Z9PcuQ.text: Lobster Overload! This is my first time trying out cousins main lobster, and it was delicious. They came to an event in Statesville, NC. Lobster everything! From quesadillas to lobster tacos!   Lobster tots and the lobster grilled cheese were my favorite. They also offer New England clam chowder which looked great and for dessert whoopie pies. Although I was disappointed on the size of the lobster roll. I understand Lobster is expensive but I expected a slightly bigger roll for $16.95. Also, the roll didn't come with a lemon wedge which could have possibly gave it flavor to the roll. For the first time customers; warning It is pricey. With 3 items (pictures down below) the total was $49 and change.   I haven't seen such a clean and mean looking food truck! Like wow! with tv screens showing pictures of different items in the menu. You could only imagine how much cleaner the inside is.   The price and the portion ratio plays a role if I'll actually buy something at this food truck. It was delicious but will probably hesitate to buy next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cousins Food Truck
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut Roll, Lobster Grilled Cheese, and Lobster Tots.

UTPrBEovc8ucm9uakq-l5Q.text: There has been a lot of hype around this food truck, so when I saw that it was going to be at my favorite brewery (Blue Blaze) last weekend, it seemed like a great time to try it.  We got a Connecticut Lobster Roll, a Lobster Grilled Cheese, Lobster Tots, and a cup of Lobster Bisque. Overall I wasn't very impressed. The lobster roll was probably my favorite, but nothing super special. I felt like I could have made the grilled cheese at home (minus lobster). The tots were ok, but it was a weird combination of cuisines (Mexican toppings with lobster). I really didn't like the lobster bisque. After I finished the grilled cheese, I didn't eat the rest of the soup.   Overall, I guess I just felt like the food was mediocre and very expensive. I know lobster is expensive, so if the food had been really good, the $55 meal would not have bothered me.   I might be the only one, but the quality to price ratio didn't cut it for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut lobster roll
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Bisque
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Grilled Cheese

F2WUhdHzRZ1G14wmFKZTNg.text: We just came back from Atlanta where we tried lobster roll in the Optimist. Have to say that I prefer Cousins Maine Lobster version of the lobster roll (we ordered Maine version, not the Connecticut one) because it keeps the original taste of the lobster. I can almost smell the fresh salt water in the air! We also ordered quesadillas but feel like the  presentation of the cheese is way to much and strong, made the lobster a minor.  And the wait time, OMG we waited more than 2 hours (this is Catawba brewing Company in Asheville) to order, wondering why??? Please do something to fix it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster roll Maine

3GIqiUJ6rCar8PRrHc_PyQ.text: 1st visit after months of waiting for the schedule to work out and it happens on my Bday yet. I will be back. This was like going to Krispy Kreme when the Hot Now sign is lite. You know they just seem to melt in your mouth. Well so did the lobster roll. Lobster was cooked perfect. The sandwich just disappeared before I knew it. There was a small downside and that was the buns needed a little more butter and longer toasting. A little more butter on the lobster.  And of course I wanted much more lobster.    I'm really thinking of Ballentine on Monday 4th to try the lobster totes. And the grilled cheese sounds interesting.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

X8yj4UdNv62yrQpdFF-ebA.text: Delicious food! I got the Maine Lobster roll and whoopie pie. I am originally from Massachusetts and this was great authentic New England food!   The lobster roll was so full of meat, my husband and I split both for lunch. Can't wait to see them again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maine Lobster roll (so good I took a bite before I could get a picture)

tlbFe8lLecbi-713Vnv8bA.text: Cousins Maine Lobster was disappointing. I watched the Shark Tank episode on which these guys were featured, so when I saw their food truck around town I had to give them a try. I absolutely love a good lobster roll, and I've had the pleasure of eating some awesome ones along the coast up North. Perhaps it was just a bit too hyped up for me, and I was expecting the delicious lobster rolls that I've had in the past, but unfortunately it was just so so. The lobster was very tough and the flavor that I was expecting just wasn't there. It was definitely overpriced for the quality that I received. I'm hoping maybe I just got a bad batch. I might consider giving them a second chance if I see them around town.

ufA5pN7VvZmoJfAExqeCkA.text: My very first lobster roll and it was so good. Cousins Maine Lobster had a food truck in the neighborhood on a pretty Friday evening. The wait was outrageous - little over an hour and a half. Luckily I was with some good company so it made for solid team bonding. The line just kept getting longer and longer behind us as the evening trickled on - creating a wait of over 2 hours. Now this lobster roll was good, but I would never wait that long for any type of bites. My lobster roll was served chilled with a touch of mayo on a New England style roll. The lobster bits were chewy and I loved the New England style bread. This roll was mini and it didn't last long at all. I only got one, but could easily have devoured 4 of these yummy rolls. Prices are steep for these, but that didn't seem to halt people from splurging at the food truck. At one point they even ran out of buns and had to call for backup. Overall a fun first experience. Looking forward to getting a lobster roll again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maine Lobster Roll.

U4Eh2E4CDm7q0jPmaE5Ryg.text: OMG this is some expensive food for not so satisfying portions. Lobster rolls are full Of meat but small. Tatter tots have no flavor and for the cost at least sprinkle some oldbay or salt on them.   Worth a try if you have about twenty bucks to spend on lunch for one.

DNUpIaw-yRnk8xteOrJqCQ.text: I tried this food truck during the 4th of July Street Party.  The lobster roll was delicious and the customer service was outstanding!!  The portion was smaller than expected but well worth it.  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut Lobster Roll
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cousins Maine Lobster food truck

Tf_O6jK3O_gnwjtue99SbA.text: I am loving the lobster roll trend sweeping through Charlotte this year.   We finally caught up with Cousins Maine Lobster outside of Good Works Cidery. It was late afternoon, just before they were closing so we hit them with no line. If you're not familiar, Cousins is a franchise that's based out of LA. They gained fame from an appearance on Shark Tank and there are now trucks across the country.  I like that they offer two different types of lobster rolls: Maine (chilled with a touch of mayo) and Connecticut (served warm with butter and lemon). They also have lobster tacos, grilled cheese, quesadilla, and tots. There's also soups, a kid's menu, and gluten free options.   Our order: two Connecticut lobster rolls and two #2 combos (tater tots and a drink). It was delicious. I could probably eat four of them. Now I will warn you, it's pricey. Our total with taxes (but before tip): $45.99. Lobster rolls are $16.95.   Check their website for the schedule and where they will be each day. They do a really great job keeping that updated.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster rolls and tots
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Connecticut lobster roll

ocf20iAl7wvVh9g0fayfEw.text: I been to Cousins Maine Lobster two times and had the Connecticut  lobster roll, which was REALLY GOOD and have a fresh taste. The size of the roll was about the size of a hot dog bun but it was packed with lobster ( which is a good thing). Because it's a food truck parking is kind of hard depending on their location that day.  The tots was greasy I could have did without them.

photos.caption: Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cousins Maine Lobster - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

I-Q2J9G5uAGUy-Kz46-JmA.text: Ok I know lobster is expensive so I will not comment on the prices and leave that up to you! I have hit up this food truck a few times and I did enjoy the lobster roll but like all the ones I have had it is not very filling to I would add the lobster bisque or the clam chowder for $5 to make it more of a meal but be prepared to pay almost $25 for that little meal:)  So why three stars you ask? Well I really feel it doesn't live up to all the hype. So that is one star and the other I deducted was for the lobster tots! I will say they were more filling that the lobster rolls but the Tex Mex taste in my humble option should never be matched with lobster meat!   If they are at a place I might think about a lobster roll but I will definitely not be seeking  them out any more:)
